pr_analysis_patterns.overview: Patterns for analyzing PRs and converting technical changes into user-focused release notes.

step.question: Why did it change?
step.focus: Understand the problem solved (check linked issues for bug fixes)

step.question: How does this impact users?
step.focus: State concrete benefits in plain language

category.name: qol_improvements
category.order: MUST come before Bug Fixes section

category.name: bug_fixes
category.format: Under ## Bug Fixes as bullet points
category.order: MUST come after QOL Improvements section

template.format:
## [Feature Name]
We've [improvement description] (thanks [contributors]!) ([#PR](link)):
- **[Benefit 1]**: [How this helps users] - **[Benefit 2]**: [Another benefit]
[Concluding sentence about impact]

contributor_rules.rule: Always include PR author (from gh pr view)
Include issue reporter if PR fixes an issue

language_guide.prefer: User benefits, plain language, concrete improvements

subtask_output_format.template:
## PR #[number]: [Title]
**Author**: [username] **Linked Issues**: #[issue] (reporter: [username]) **Category**: [Category] **User Impact**: [Benefit description] **Contributors**: [list] **Documentation Needs**: [none|docs-new|docs-update|docs-example|docs-migration] **Documentation Notes**: [If applicable, what needs documenting]
---
subtask_output_format.critical: Append to temp_pr_analysis.md using insert_content line 0

trigger.files: New files in src/, new commands, new tools
trigger.label: docs-new
